page.title: 02Geography of Weston and Area
page.content:
The{landscape}of this area is mainly agricultural land with scattered farms. There are four small patches of{woodland:}Weston Wood (which is owned by the Forestry Commission), Park Copse, Meizen Copse and Blackleys. The land is fairly flat and low lying; the average height above sea level being about 65 metres. There are several small{streams}which drain southwards to the River Ray. The underlying{soils}are mainly clays.
The area is dominated by two busy{main {roads;}the A43 Oxford to Northampton Road and the A421 to Bicester which branches off it just south of Weston. The only other roads are quiet country lanes. The{railway line}from Bicester to Oxford crosses the area as do many {public footpaths}including the Oxford- shire Way which passes through Weston.
